docs.snippet: How a misinformed Twitter post the night after the presidential election fueled a nationwide conspiracy theory and became a talking point — even as it was being proved false.

headline.print_headline: The Journey of a Fake News Story That Begins With a Single Tweet
headline.main: How Fake News Goes Viral: A Case Study

docs.snippet: New Jersey State Police say the general manager of a company that operates radio stations complimented a trooper in a letter after he was ticketed for speeding.

headline.print_headline: Police: Man Thanks Trooper in Letter After Speeding Ticket
headline.main: Police: Man Thanks Trooper in Letter After Speeding Ticket

docs.snippet: Ukraine says Russia is refusing to hand over jailed Ukrainian filmmaker Oleg Sentsov, who was convicted of conspiracy to commit terror attacks by a Russian military court in 2015 and sentenced to 20 years in prison.

A man who won a $23 million lawsuit against a Florida sheriff's office this year after being shot by a deputy and paralyzed has been arrested on charges that he sold heroin, marijuana and cocaine near a preschool.

headline.print_headline: Deputies Arrest Paralyzed Man Who Won $23 Million Verdict
headline.main: Deputies Arrest Paralyzed Man Who Won $23 Million Verdict

docs.snippet: The purpose of the chatbots was to rant, confuse people or muddy discussions on Twitter in the days before the election, an Oxford University report found.

headline.print_headline: Trump Won Battle of Ranting, Raving Twitter Robots, Researchers Say
headline.main: Automated Pro-Trump Bots Overwhelmed Pro-Clinton Messages, Researchers Say

docs.snippet: The 16-year-old was taken into custody after The Daily News said he had sent a threatening message to a reporter who wrote about the students’ public fights.

headline.print_headline: Student at Elite Bronx High School Is Arrested Over a Threat to a Reporter
headline.main: Bronx Science Student Arrested After Threat Over ‘Fight Club’ Article

docs.snippet: Actress Shailene Woodley has pleaded not guilty in a North Dakota court to criminal trespass and riot charges after her arrest in a protest against the Dakota Access pipeline.

headline.print_headline: Actress Pleads Not Guilty in North Dakota Pipeline Protest
headline.main: Actress Pleads Not Guilty in North Dakota Pipeline Protest

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Hasina must rigorously investigate her own party, the Awami League.
Police in Virginia Beach are conducting an internal review after an officer was captured on video struggling with a woman on the ground as he handcuffed her.

headline.print_headline: Police Review Officer's Struggle With Woman Shown on Video
headline.main: Police Review Officer's Struggle With Woman Shown on Video
